messages.message:
I'm not seeing any provenance in human review.
This is on UAT, in the `shared-workspace-docs` workspace, but I have the same results in other workspaces.

This video also shows me fumbling around with _absolutely_ no idea how to "open the editor to view validation details."
And we shouldn't be using "please" in UI text, ever.
cc: @andy
i’m able to see provenance for my app run, but i think you’re using document-based (not run-based) Human Review, and I don’t have a document-based Human Review link to open rn :disappointed:

i found a way to open document-based Human Review, and i’m still seeing provenance

@melissa.amos which app did you run?
This is a run of my "Review queue test deployment" deployment. It's not specifically configured to be document-based; I have that option disabled.
theres no configuration, review should always done in document-based review for a deployment
the run-based or file-based configuration is more for STP and to decide how reviews get assigned
So enabling the workflow queue option automatically uses document-based review. Got it.
i opened document-based human review for something run through that deployment, and i see provenance
@melissa.amos no, even before queues existed, when you run a deployment and review the results through the review tab, it is always document-based
the distinction between document and the old run-based review is confusing and I'm working on trying to alleviate that soon!
I re-ran the deployment and get the same results (no provenance). I don't get provenance even on older deployment runs that are still hanging out in review.
yah the weird thing here is that the field shows a page number meaning provenance should exist for it, but is not showing up. I'll take a look at this later
what org is this workspace (shared-workspace-docs) in? @melissa.amos
Hm, I see provenance for the same deployment on all the docs in the review table too. There is no setting that should hide provenance so I'm not sure how Melissa is seeing something different.
Just checking... I have all default-on internal preview features enabled, and _only_ *Enabling review queues in deployments* in the internal opt-in enabled.

yah none of the preview features should affect the provenance in human review. The only provenance setting is "Show source for selected field only" but thats not the issue for you since the field you have selected still is not showing its provenance.
